Reviews.Title: “UGH...”
Reviews.Author: JWHPSU
Reviews.Content: I have never been a fan of Radisson hotels. The ONLY reason why I stayed at this property was because I was in town for a conference and all of the downtown Phoenix hotels were so OVER PRICED that it was ridiculous. While my stay at this hotel wasn't bad, the only thing it was good for was the price. First of all, the elevators in this hotel were SO SLOW that it was mind boggling. The room was OK, towels were like sand paper and the sleep number control for my bed did not work. The carpet throughout the hotel looked really old, worn and dirty and the gym was a closet with two treadmills (One of which was broken) and no towels to use. Finally, there was a seedy adult boutique on the corner which made the area feel dirty even though I felt completely safe walking around at night. The hotel was convenient to the light rail so getting downtown and to the airport was a breeze but other than that, this hotel was nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Awful gym - nasty pools - needs another facelift - nice bartender”
Reviews.Author: Greg_H_DC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week while attending a conference downtown. While the hotel was clean you could tell that they were on a budget when they remodeled the place. The bathroom's had old bathtubs and the new paint didn't come all the way down to the floors. On the website it clearly states that all rooms have upgraded beds, but mine was old, dingy and not very comfortable (I should have asked to switch when I checked in.) Speaking of checking in, when I was checking in (after waiting for the one guy on duty to get off the phone for a good three minutes - which is a lot if you are the only one in the lobby with the only employee in the place - the guy on the phone was offered a lower rate than I was paying - can't you do this from the back office?) I was given little info and sent to my room. If I was paying for this I would have renegotiated or even walked away. I also selected this place due to it's gym (which is an absolute joke - if you are looking for a small room with three antiquated machines that don't even work, this is your place) and the pools are dirty and not very inviting. The only great thing about this hotel is that it's close to the tram (a four minute walk and then a 20 minute ride to downtown) and the bartender. The free breakfast also isn't that bad (although I did just stick with the fruit and toast.) Suggestions for management: upgrade the gym so someone can actually work out there or be truthful on your website about the gym, pool, check-in folks and state of the rooms. While walking to the tram I did see the Extended Stay Deluxe Midtown which looked brand new from the outside, so you may want to check out that place (but again I haven't been or stayed there).

Reviews.Title: “Needs a spruce up.....”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: don't get a room anywhere near an elevator. You'll be up all night. Front desk helpful but the property seems very understaffed. Difficult to get assistance If needed. Arrived room - no soap, towels, ironing board. We had to move due to horrendously loud elevator noises.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: jenkcallander
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at various Radisson hotels throughout Canada and the United States. However, this property was disgusting. It was dirty, dingy and really could use some money to upgrade its facilities. In addition, try and find it. The signage was terrible. There was a little Radission sign that was upstaged by a Holiday Inn sign. The fellow at the front desk was the one saving grace. He let us check in early and gave us a small welcome gift. He also offered great suggestions for places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “We were very dissatisfied with the Radisson!!”
Reviews.Author: NotHappyNM
Reviews.Content: We had made reservations for two beds but when we arrived to check in they did not have any rooms left with two beds. So we had to stay in a room with a king bed for the night. We were assured that the following day we would be moved to a room with two beds, once by the front desk clerk and the following morning by the manager. We left for the day and upon returning the desk clerk said they did not have anymore rooms available with two beds. The desk clerk made a call to housekeeping to check on a room that may possibly be available and we finally got to move into a different room. We called the front desk three times for extra towels and it was never brought to our room. I approached two housekeepers but of whom said they didn't have extra towels. The air conditioner in the room kept coming on even when we kept powering it off. The carpets were very dirty and I would not recommend this hotel at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: 4MONTHSAGO
Reviews.Content: I arrived from chicago and matt the gm greeted me as he walked out the door, wonderful property and warm, welcoming staff!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: maureen b
Reviews.Content: When I arrived with my 2 sons, i was told my room would have one bed, though I reserved 2 queens for 4 nights. The clerk acted like he was doing me a favor by "upgrading" me to a cabana suite. One king bed, sofa bed, leaky toilet, noisy air conditioning, and dirty carpet. The worst part was the party at the pool happening 5 feet from our door,lasting past 1am, hosted by men in various degrees of dress including t shirts that read "I love ---- plugs"! We left the next morning. Totally inappropriate - never again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but the hotel is dated”
Reviews.Author: FLR
Reviews.Content: The outside and lobby of this hotel is nice. The staff was helpful and friendly. We were even given the Cabana Suite that others had mentioned. It was quickly evident that this hotel needs to be updated. As I walked down the hall you could see the very dirty carpet. The furnishings seemed worn and the suite was dark. There was one window that looked out to the very tiny pool. There was another pool but it didn't look very clean. The garden/pool area did not look bad but it was not inviting either. They have a very small fitness room that I used in the morning. The breakfast looked minimal so we decided to go elsewhere. Again the staff was the best part of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “this place is a dump”
Reviews.Author: david s
Reviews.Content: Only one ice maker for a six story building, ice cold swimming pool filthy floors, broken a/c and so on and so on... The features advertize are very misleading

Reviews.Title: “Very brief visit but happy with stay”
Reviews.Author: IanC67
Reviews.Content: I arrived very late and departed very earlier the next morning so I don't have a lot to say however I was happy with what I experienced. Not the hotels fault...the journey to the hotel from the airport was very extended as it was the first night for the driver and he couldn't get used to driving, following navigation and replying to messages on his radio...2 hours for a 20 minute journey. I therefore arrived very late. In appreciation of my tiredness check in was quick, friendly and efficient; I was in my room in minutes. The standard rooms are modern, clean and spacious. I only managed to grab a quick breakfast and I was close to the end of the breakfast shift; what was available was minimal and looked dry due to being out for so long. Check out was also quick and efficient. I would probably return if business takes me back to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: MissTravelsALott
Reviews.Content: The computers are extremely old, don't work, and very dirty. Yuck. We got two queens, instead of a king like we booked. The beds were sleep number beds, which are the most uncomfortable beds I've ever slept on. The room would either be extremely hot or extremely cold. Not to mention the room reeked of smoke. Across the street is a sketchy "adult boutique". Absolutely nothing to do in the area. Oh and the pool outside was freezing and dirty. Awful experience, save your money and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: MaxnKel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend getaway. Good location, close to freeways and plenty of dining. Amber at the front desk was terrific, she was very nice and welcoming. When I was checking in I asked her for a room on the 6th floor so I wouldn't hear anyone above me, and she offered to move me to a Cabana Suite, which has nobody above you. It had a small living area in addition to the bedroom, which was really nice. Our room was clean, plenty of pillows and towels. There was a small refrigerator and microwave, which was nice. Breakfast was included in the rate, it was average. Eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon, bagels, toast, etc. The server was very nice. Parking was very easy, free self parking.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great night before my flight”
Reviews.Author: BullysPub
Reviews.Content: I had just spent the last 4 days in the desert outside of Wickenburg, Az. and was ready for a nice relaxing night back in civilazation, and the Radisson delivered. They have a great restaurant, a nice little lounge and very friendly staff. The front desk clerk upgraded me to a two room suite. It was bigger then I needed but sure was nice. The suite was equiped with two wide screen tv's, a incredibe bed and was clean and comfortable. I also ate at the restaurant and had a great meal. The server, whose name I forget but she has red hair, was friendly and attentive. Could not have had a better over all experience at this hotel. I travel to Phoenix and the Wickenburg area about once a month. This Radisson will be my first choice whenever Im close by.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovesbacon d
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here a few weeks ago and enjoyed the grounds. Rooms are clean food was really good and every one that I passed in the hall smiled. I will be back in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Garden Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Dee J
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with deeleareus' review. The garden and pool areas are absolutely gorgeous. We held our daughter's wedding, reception and rehearsal dinner there. The reception was held in the Coronado Room and the food was fantastic! Usually catered wedding food isn't memorable, but the chicken Oscar style was a huge hit. I can't believe how many compliments we received from family and friends about the food, table decor, and the staff. The wait staff was very attentive to our guests' needs and were very pleasant. Rochelle was extremely helpful with the coordination of logistics to help make my daughter's special day a wonderful experience. We also held our rehearsal dinner at the hotel for the convenience of our out of town guests. The food and service was also great. Our guests enjoyed their stay so much that now when they come to town for visits, they only want to stay at the Radisson. I recommend this hotel not only for lodging, but for weddings or special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Great property for the money”
Reviews.Author: LatinDrummer
Reviews.Content: This is a good value for staying downtown. Staff is friendly, helpful and the rooms are spacious with modern amenities, flat screen televisions and free wireless internet. Parking is free and in a parking garage adjacent to the hotel. I have stayed here twice and been happy with the value each time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location”
Reviews.Author: Dittydot
Reviews.Content: We settled on the Radisson because it was cheaper than some other hotels downtown but still off the Light Rail. We were able to walk to the hotel from the rail station and the area seemed safe. The room was clean and comfortable -- nothing special but nothing bad either. We were on the 5th floor, which also has access to the rooftop pool. My only complaint is that the website said the two outdoor pools were heated. Now, I'm from Chicago and I swim in Lake Michigan so I am used to cold water. I know it gets cold in winter in Phoenix, but if you're going to advertise a "heated" pool, then you'd better deliver. The main pool was so cold my toes went numb after dipping them in for 20 seconds. The rooftop pool was about Lake Michigan temperature -- tolerable but NOT heated. It was still nice to sit on the rooftop and lay in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating, remodeling”
Reviews.Author: r0napark
Reviews.Content: Requested a quiet room on a high floor, got a room next to ice/pop machine and elevators, on the third (there are 6)floor. Bathroom seems to be where management is economizing. One bar of soap for both shower and sink, thin worn-out small bath towels, mini bottles of shampoo, etc. When we arrived at front portico, saw irrigation system spraying all over the building and drive, instead of watering vegetation. Overall, TLC is non-existent and appears to be on its way to closing.

Reviews.Title: “Basic motel”
Reviews.Author: cherell
Reviews.Content: Had a great rate. It was difficult to sleep - either air conditioner was on and very load or it was off and the room was stuffy. Needed more towels in the room - called the front desk and they told me I can pick them up myself (at the front desk).

Reviews.Title: “Okay but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: SquirePew
Reviews.Content: Functional hotel but rather tiered looks and decor. No sleep number bed in my room which was noisy overlooking the outside bar area. Staff helpfull enough but will not be on my list for any return business trip.

Reviews.Title: “great place - great price”
Reviews.Author: sekake
Reviews.Content: nice room, free breakfast, convenient location (had a car). nice pool (nice and cool in 104 degrees), but no hot tub (who thought you would need one in Phoenix!). Plenty of towels. Desk staff was great. asked for quiet room and got it. Free parking

Reviews.Title: “Radisson City Center Phoenix AZ”
Reviews.Author: marysview
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a stay at the Radisson City Center in Phoenix. I had a two night stay as I was there for a short family visit. The price I received going through Hotels.com was awesome! The airfares into Phoenix are ridiculously hgh so to find a reasonable priced hotel is a plus. When I checked in the staff was courteous and professional. The lobby looked fine. It was when I got into the elevator I almost fainted. It was really dirty and the carpet was stained and torn. As I stepped off the elevator onto my floor the lobby and hallway to my room didn't look any better. I was scared to open my door ...almost didnt. But to my shock and surprise I found a completely newly renovated and updated room. It was great. New everything including 2 queen sleep number beds !! I could only surmise they were doing all the rooms first and would eventually get to those nasty elevators and hallways. time at the Radisson was comfortable, quiet and safe. I would recommend them to any traveller looking to stay in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “It was exactly what I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: CMHtraveldude
Reviews.Content: I mean, come on guys it's a mid-level hotel. It was not great, it was not horrible, it was exactly what you would expect from an older Radisson Hotel. It appears they "refreshed" the hotel a few years ago to try for a more modern look, and it still looks that way, but everything just looks a bit worn. The big pluses were the crisp sheets, and i'm always happy when you can actully get a cold A/C. The pool area was quite nice also. On the minus side, it was a bit worn and the towels were a bit rough. But again, I was not upset nor overjoyed, it was exactly what i expected it to be. If you are just looking for a place to stay downtown and save some $$'s I would say this is a safe bet. I would totally stay here again without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for training / conference”
Reviews.Author: SavageFrontier
Reviews.Content: Stayed here September 2011 for an engineering training conference. Room was good. New TV, comfortable bed, shower and bathroom were good. Pleasant grounds with fun pool (has waterfall) and trees, benches for taking in the sunset. Restaurant and bar were also fun with live music on Wednesday night. Dinners were a great deal for the price. Conference room was also good (about 24 attendees in our class) with coffee, soft drinks, and pastries provided. Staff was friendly. No complaints at all about this facility

Reviews.Title: “Great location to Light Rail”
Reviews.Author: jpad108
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson because we were going to the DBacks game and wanted to be close to the light rail. Although we got lost trying to find the hotel, it really is in a very convenient location to the light rail, businesses, and St Joseph hospital. Their signage is rather small, but they are actually right behind the Holiday Inn. The outside of the hotel is nothing special to look at, but they have a parking garage which in Phoenix in the summer is a huge plus. The lobby is small but well done. The breakfast area is actually larger than it looks because it is sectioned. If the weather is nice you could actually eat outside. Their ground floor pools are very nice with waterfalls. The courtyard grounds are very nicely landscaped and they have a volleyball court and a childrens' playground. Due to a problem with our room, we actually stayed in two different rooms. The casita rooms on the roof are very nice because they are actually two rooms each with their own flat screen tv, but they are smaller than the regular rooms because of their being two rooms. The roof pool is not as nice as the ground floor pools, but it's Phoenix and it's Summer - nuff said. The casita rooms all open onto the roof which in cooler weather would be really nice with a really nice view of Camelback from the roof. Our second room was a sleep number king. The sleep number bed did not impress me, but the room was very bright, large, and nicely decorated. Both rooms had microwaves, coffee pots, and refrigerators. Both rooms were very clean and did not look dingy as some have suggested. The breakfast, which for our rate was not free was $10 per person, but it was one of the better buffets I have had in a hotel. They had juice, fruit, french toast, and a variety of hot and cold foods. Our coffee was constantly being replenished. In all instances the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our only complaints are that the towels in our room were almost threadbare, and the a/c in the sleep number room had a fan that circulated on and off all night, keeping us awake for the better part of the night no matter what we did to try to shut it off. The hotel itself was very quiet and you could not hear any road or hospital noises. All in all, a very nice hotel in an area that is safe, and very convenient to the light rail and a lot of museums, restaurants, and the sports stadiums.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price in an ideal location for downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoWeatherMan
Reviews.Content: At only $59/night, this was well worth the price. The service and greeting were excellent. The room was adequate and clean enough. The free breakfast was good. No real issues except that the property is a little outdated looking. Will stay there again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Amazing Pools, Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: JRJM710
Reviews.Content: We had a great time exploring the city using the lightrail which had a stop very close to the hotel (5 min walk maximum). There were really tasty restaurants nearby (Thai Basil, The Good Egg, and FEZ) and anything else we were able to access by lightrail (way cheaper than renting a car). The front desk explained how to use the light rail and a map on how to get to certain locations. The Arizona Science Center was so much fun (for kids, teachers, and kids at heart). The pools were great at this hotel, we spent most of our day in the beautiful pool on the first floor with waterfalls. And the evening was spent at the rooftop pool, which was a bit to hot during the daytime. I'd definitely come back. Oh, and there is a Walgreen's nearby so you can stock up on water, and things you forgot! The internet was typically pretty slow, so that may be a drawback for you, but it wasn't a big deal. The hotel restaurant was really good too, so that was always another option!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jessica10225
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to take my son to watch the Dodgers play at Chase Stadium for his 13th birthday and picked this hotel last minute. We checked in at around 10:30 pm. When we arrived we were looking so forward to getting in the pool and when we did it was perfect! No one bothered us and the temperature was nice! The actual hotel itself is good for the price. Although, it does need cleaning in the courtyard. Also, the hallway to our room was not clean. Kinda dirty. In fact, I made my kids wear shoes to go to the vending machine down the hall. Otherwise, hotel is decent and the rooms were okay, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: mmsouth
Reviews.Content: Our 3 chidren under age 8 & I went with my husband on a business trip & enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Clean hotel, location easy to get in & around downtown Phoenix. Shower had weak water pressure & when I spoke with front desk he informed me that they were process of changing all shower heads. Other than that no complaints, clean nice stay for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bobo86
Reviews.Content: this hotel is dirty, smells like mold badly, and alot of the rooms inside have BED BUGS! the AC doesnt work in the cabana suites...which when its 115 in phoenix is a HUGE problem. The pics look great but the place is dirty. Even the pool was gross. The food was so bad that we didnt even bother going to eat the second morning we were there even though it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Exciting Here”
Reviews.Author: zonagurl
Reviews.Content: Wasn't too impressed with this old run down hotel. We were in a suite by the pool and the TV was like ancient and couldn't even get it to work because of the cable boxes they are still using. What the heck? Where's the flat screen TVs?? Furniture is super old and there was too much furniture in the room that made it hard to move around. Towels are super dingy and not even a bright white. I didn't even want to use them. The Radisson could definitely use a renovation at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice safe clean place”
Reviews.Author: gracielufreebush
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a safe area i felt safe traveling alone. They have sleep number beds which are ok and definately better than average. The rooms are roomy and clean with nice tv and i stayed two different nights one on the way to sedona and one the night before my flight left from phoenix. The hotels rates were cheaper than expedia rates i paid the first night 133.00 through expedia and the last night 112.00

Reviews.Title: “Could use updating - seemed like a dead place”
Reviews.Author: deputysher
Reviews.Content: A bit shopworn and understaffed, perhaps due to the recession. Spent 3 nights here due to business meeting. The bed was comfortable enough; tho many of our colleagues actually had Sleep Number beds, we did not. The bathroom was fine - nothing special. Major issues: 1) When we checked in, after going to our room, I callled down to the front desk to request a down pillow. The clerk on duty did not know what a down pillow was...I had to describe a feather pillow! We were alloted only one bar of soap for our entire visit, so had to move it from tub to sink and back. After the first night, all our wash cloths, and complimentary toiletries were not replaced daily, altho sometimes one item might reappear. The worst part of our stay tho, was the room air conditioner. When it is on, it is so loud you cannot hear the television (which has not yet been upgraded to a flat screen). At night the air conditioner is particularly bothersome as the loudness of it wakes you up, which doesn't help you get a good night's sleep. The breakfast buffet that came with our room had no variety whatsoever during the 3 days we were there: terrible biscuits & gravy, dry scrambled eggs, greasy linked sausage, limp bacon, some fresh fruit, yogurt, and sugary cold cereal. The outdoor courtyard looked pretty and had a pool, but the weather was cold and rainy while we were there. We held a morning meeting on Saturday after meeting elsewhere in town for 2 days, but when we needed to find the bathroom for the meeting area, we learned we had to go outside and down a long cold hallway in the rain, to the ladies room. Not good. It was freezing -- only 49 degrees and raining! No warm water in the restroom either. If you have a choice, I'd choose another property nearby -- there was a Holiday Inn Express next door and a very new Extended Stay Suites on the corner across the small intersection. By the way, their buisness center (!) is a computer and printer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Save yourself money and get quality customer service...stay Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: jlawton73
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff don't seem to know what customer service means. Front desk and other employees walking ground seed rude and unfriendly. Two of three small pools have a broken heater and don't appear to have been cleaned in quite sometime..over a week per front desk. Two of four pool fountains weren't operational. Room wasn't very clean or done in 5min or less. As a former Carlson employee its disappointing to see the normally high standards no longer apply.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating and friendly”
Reviews.Author: docfam
Reviews.Content: I'm very appreciative for the staff (Matt) and the hotel's willingness to accommodate our large group (15 rooms) at the last minute. Not only did they work with us on our rates but they accommodated our group's size, room preferences, dining requirements and more. I felt like the front desk manager made decisions for Radisson as he would if it were his own company. We are very grateful to be in this hotel and I would highly recommend this property to others.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: CleanseBenefitsBlog
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay at the hotel for a work related school for 4 days. My wife decided to bring the kids up the day before so we could spend some time together before my week started. There were some issues with the room when we first arrived. The air conditioner wasn't working and the signal on the television wasn't the greatest; however, when we did call for maintenance the service was prompt, efficient and courteous. My 10 year old was disappointed to find that neither of the pools was heated. I used the gym on several occasions and although there are free weights there was no bench. I was originally supposed to switch rooms the day after my family left but they chose to let me stay in the suite which was very nice. The hotel is a little off the regular pather but overall, it is a nice businessman's hotel. http://www.cleansebenefits.com http://blog.cleansebenefits.com

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in America”
Reviews.Author: Mandismoments
Reviews.Content: Recently my family and I had the worst stay of our lives at the Phoenix Radisson. We arrived at the Radisson in Phoenix, AZ (3600 N 2nd Ave; Phoenix, AZ 85013) on February 13, 2011 and stayed until February 21, 2011. My husband and I travel for a living (on the road 24/7) so we fly our parents in to see us in different cities each year. This year, we booked our room at the Radisson (huge mistake) thinking that it would be a relaxing, upscale hotel. Online it states that every room is equipped with a coffee maker, mini fridge, and microwave along with other things. This is important because we bring our own food. Upon arrival at the hotel, my parent's reservations were not found. It took about 30 minutes of phone calls to me and research for the front desk staff to find their reservations. Once in, their room had no washcloths, coffee maker (but the coffee was there), and no mini fridge. They called down to ask for replacement items but they said they were out and they had to stay in this room. For the first few days of our stay we did not have washcloths and housekeeping was extremely rude--I would try to say hi and ask how their day was going and they would speak in Spanish to each other and completely ignore me; then they didn't even show up some days. What topped the experience was two nights before I was scheduled to leave, housekeeping CLEARED MY ROOM! Imagine arriving "home" at 2 am to a completely empty room! My retainers, $100 toothbrush, supersized bottle of brand new mouthwash, underwear, bra, etc missing. My key still worked and my room was empty. In conclusion, this was the WORST hotel that I have ever stayed in. I do not look forward to coming back to Phoenix for a week next year and will never stay at a Radisson hotel ever again since my experience with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location”
Reviews.Author: otombeur
Reviews.Content: Not the greatest location in town as nothing around. Rooms are tired and need some work! Staff is friendly and always very attentive to customers needs.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely wasnt thrilled with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tre28
Reviews.Content: Prior to entering my bid on Priceline, i checked out all the hotels in the area to see what their accomadations were like. This hotel advertised that they had "Sleep Number" beds, which to me, a quality mattress is very important. So when the Radisson accepted my bid i felt pretty confident my stay would be enjoyable. After checking in we noticed we definitely did not have "Sleep Number" beds in our room and i felt the beds were actually sub-standand (hard as a rock). I guess i was wrong to assume that all rooms had the same quality of beds. When i complained the next morning i was told b/c of the lower rate thru Priceline, we were placed in a lower quality room. But the lady at the desk was friendly and happily placed us in a better room. The room was still on the small side (jus enough room to navigate around the beds and desk, def not spacious as pictured as a "standard room" on their website) and the TV wasnt the greatest. I thought it was odd to provide a microwave but not a refridgerator. I was told the pools were heated but i dont think so since the water was very cold. On a more positive note, the grounds of the hotel were nice, the rooftop terrance was enjoyable and parking was simple. The lobby was nice but of course first impressions are everything. It's a short walking distance to the Light Rail and a few fast food restaurants. The hotel was somewhat hard to find and there is indeed an adult bookstore on the corner lol. But at no time did i feel unsafe with the area. I might add that this hotel has not always been a "Radisson". My friend who moved to Arizona 6 years ago stayed here (under a different name, not a chain) for $39.00 a night while searching for an apartment. It seems they still have alot work to do to bring it up to par with other Radisson Hotels. Overall my stay wasnt horrible, but if i had paid more then $70.00 a night i'd probally of been really upset. I doubt i'd stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: deeleareus
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here only because we had Gold Points that we wanted to use. The hotel is very hard to find behind a Holiday Inn with a very small dark sign on the corner. Parking is a bit tight, but once we actually made it into the property we had a very pleasant stay. We arrived late in the evening and had a fast, pleasant check in. The room has only 1 king bed, but it did have a microwave and a small refrigerator. Since the room only had 1 bed it felt every spacious. The landscaping was great..they have an awesome area for wedding ceremonies that isn't really shown on the website. The pool is small but has a wonderful waterfall..would like to stay again in the hotter months just to use that pool. Many reviews are correct in stating that a adult book store is across the street, but we did not feel unsafe walking to the drug store around the corner after dark. Nice restaurant on site..a little pricey though. We enjoyed our stay and would definately stay again. Thanks Radisson City Center.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: regalsea03sapphire
Reviews.Content: was supposed to be a relaxing night away, was all but that. the heater did not work in the room. the number bed we had was very uncomfortable, and noticed the shampoo and conditioner in the room had already been used and not replaced by the maid. also, the coffee pot was filthy. will not stay there again and will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: 19MJ74
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Radisson and if this is what Radisson Standard is supposed to be, we say thank you but not again. First of all - there is no sign of a Radisson on the hotel, leading to the hotel and the hotel itself is very hard to find hidden behind trees and a wall. First impression VERY BAD. There is a SEX SHOP just across the street and the area seems to be quite dodgy, we did not feel safe there. After very plesant and quick check in another negative suprise. With the exception of Reception area, te whole hotel simply stinks like mold, you feel like there is no fresh air in the corridors and especially the rooms. The property feels old, mouldy and very bad maintained. Dont get fooled by their homepage video. The rooms are Motel 6 standard with the dirtiest windows I have ever seen on our US travels. Even though the breakfast was good and the staff were nice the property is very run down. The Radisson Phoenix Central is certainly the reason we will NEVER AGAIN stay at a RADISSON. Around 80$ was a rip off for what we got. IF I PAY FOR RADISSON I CERTAINLY EXCPECT RADISSON. What we got was a travelodge at best.

Reviews.Title: “a little too far away from the action”
Reviews.Author: Balding_Bon_Viveur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just fine as far as the sprawl of phoenix is concerned, but to get to the limited `action' that phoenix offers is just a little too offputting. Dont get us wrongI think wed go back there but it was rahter daunting to use public transport into phoenix, or once again to find a taxi. This hotel has a nice bar, plenty of amenities, and clean huge rooms, but I would most likely be tempted to either head further downtown next time, or choose Tempe or Scottsdale. The hotel though is close to the Heard Museum, and an easy drive to either of the places mentioned, euqally if you were ogg to watch the Suns or the Diamondbacks theres a tram nearby that will take you there. The staff though were all really great and made our stay very nice.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel, awesome staff"”
Reviews.Author: evushi
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel, close to everything i needed and has all the amenities . The staff was very friendly and proffesional. will make sure to stay here again when in PHX :).

Reviews.Title: “Not Again”
Reviews.Author: ciaoTexas
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because the downtown hotels were full and were assured that the hotel would shuttle the group of us each morning and afternoon to our downtown office. One day half of our group got left downtown and had to call a local colleague to come get us. When I checked in, I had to clean the bathroom with a washrag and soap because the counter had toothpaste all over it and other spots. There were rings on the desk where the previous guest had obviously set a drink. The room was musty. The air switched between air conditioning and heat....so you either froze or sweated since you couldn't adjust the vent on the window unit. I finally put my ironing board ontop so it wouldn't blow right on the bed. There was no pad on the ironing board. No wireless and the cord was about 2 ft. long. but then you had to sit at the dirty desk. I walked down to the Walgreens to get Clorox wipes but had to walk past a sex shop with a parking lot full of patrons. Finally the tv.........you were suppose to aim the remote at the box next to the tv but mine never worked or worked for a minute and then quit. I asked for batteries at the desk and they acted like I was crazy. I tell you except for two people the staff was clueless and could have carried less. The beds were HARD and uncomfortable. On top of that for business travelers, there is only a couple of places to walk to to eat. And the fitness place involves walking outside of the hotel around the corner to a secluded area...not really safe. My colleague changed rooms twice: once because there was standing water in her room, once because the air wouldn't go below 78. We all checked out early and moved to another hotel as fast as we could.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: JLH79
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. The hotel was filthy dirty and the housekeping staff left at 4pm. My room was not cleaned and they all smelt musty. The sleep number beds were horrible, my remote didn't work and neither did my movie rental function. There was no WiFi- seriously??? My colleage had crickets in her AC. Each time the front desk was called they just said "oh sorry." There was never a a manager or supervisor on staff and the night staff was very rude. I will never stay in a raddison again. Stear clear of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel and the staff are...”
Reviews.Author: voyger1
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and the staff are amazing I've never met better. We were given a lift to a bar by one of the receptionists at no charge we were also allowed to check out late 4pm again no charge. Look out for Brian the barman who brews a wicked cocktail. The only problem with this hotel and hence the overall score is that you can't get a drink or any food (there is a small tuck shop water crisps coke) to speak of between 10am and 4 pm. We sat by the pool in 100 degrees but could not get food or drink. It's too hot to walk anywhere and everything is spread out in this city (15 min walk to nearest place to eat) so the lack of food is a real problem. The hotel also needs to sort out the five deck chairs all of which are broken Great hotel as long as you are out all day.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Stay All Around”
Reviews.Author: TorontoKrista
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for a few nights a few weeks ago and were amazed at the cleanliness, customer service, location, food, and also the beautiful surroundings. They have 3 outdoor pools: 2 near the courtyard on the first level with beautiful water fountains and landscaping, and one on the 5th floor (on the roof) We stayed in a King Cabana Suite on the roof so when we walked out of our suite the pool was literly right there.. We stayed at different hotels for a 2 week period on vacation and this hotel had superiour customer service compaired to the other places.. Everyone was extreamly friendly, helpful, and they even kept the pool opened a little late for us (the rooftop one). The courtyard was also very beautiful to sit and enjoy the scenery and also to cool down in the shade from those hot Arizona days. I would recomend this hotel to anyone staying in the phoenix area!! And when I go back I know where I will be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “How can you not stay here”
Reviews.Author: 4MONTHSAGO
Reviews.Content: The location wasnt that great, a little hard to find. The service was spectacular! The rooms were fine, and the grounds were great. Nice pool-both of them. Nice lobby and decore in the rooms. Our family found this hotel so we wouldnt have to stay with realitives. i'm glad we did. We will come back every year!

Reviews.Title: “Did not feel safe”
Reviews.Author: andrea0123
Reviews.Content: The parking garage is around the corner and I did not feel safe with a teenage daughter. The adult bookstore across the street didn't help. The room was dirty and the carpet needs replaced. The tub didn't drain so you're standing in ankle deep water when you're done with the shower. The air conditioning unit did not work well - cold then kicks heat on randomly. Pillows were hard and worn. Upon check out I complained but the desk clerk didn't care. The only plus was the pool which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: kehicks00
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at the Convention Center, downtown, and wanted a convenient and affordable hotel (others were sooo expensive around the Center!). We enjoyed our stay here. Positives: Hotel shuttle service was great and ran on the hour to/from Convention Ctr. All I had to do was call them up if I wanted a lift back to the hotel. Room was clean, and we were able to get a room with a refrig and microwave (upon availability) since we were there for 1 week. Able to walk to Light Rail, which was a great way to travel back and forth, as well. (Purchased a light rail/trolley ticket, but it was never collected....hmmmm. :) EASY, safe travel). Breakfast was really good, but costs $11. Negs: I didn't like walking to the hotel from the trolley/Light Rail after 9 :30 (when the hotel shuttle service stopped running) since there were no lights on the streets. If walking with a buddy for the 1.5 blocks, not so bad, but still...we were two women in an unknown environment....I didn't care for that. so, keep this in mind if hanging out late in downtown Phoenix. The A.C. unit intermittently stopped running during the night, so we were sweating and then cold throughout the night...not good. It was difficult to adjust the AC temp so that we were always comfortable. :( Hotel controlled this, I'm sure. No shuttle service on the weekends. But, again, the Light Rain runs until 1 am (?) so this was not a real problem for us. Used the hotel "wake up call" one night in order to wake up in the early AM. I received a call to wake up around 11 pm.....hmmm....not sure what happened there! "Business Center"...not really existent. They had a computer that we could use to download conference materials (powerpoints) for free; however, the computer was sooo painfully slow that I only used it one time. Had to reboot several times. So, bring materials before arriving? Food choices around the area.....if on foot, it might be hard to get to some places. We ate downtown before going home (mostly). Generally, we enjoyed where we stayed. It worked out well, and was VERY affordable and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Havasugal7
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is close to Hospitals and Freeways.Hotel is clean and the Staff on the front Desk is very friendly.If you call the hotel direct and have to family at hospital the rates are lower then when you book on line

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: irunsorfaraway
Reviews.Content: Experience was wonderful. Staff was great. Food was pretty good, and the rooms were clean (great change from other hotels in the area). I will be back with the family to enjoy the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: ljbutts
Reviews.Content: I stay at this prpoerty every time I am in Phoenix which is every 4-6 weeks. Excelent property. Great staff...friendly always take s care of any needs or problems. Restaraunt is very good. Staff for the morning buffet are the hardest working people around. Comnfortable beds. Quiet rooms. Good location. Parking could be better but not as bad as some places. Only place I stay in Phoenix. Always recognize me by name and are always friendly and attentive. Grreat rates as well!!!Highly recommend it....but not too much....dont want them to not have room for me!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Phoenix City Center is Best Kept Secret in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: jacob1008
Reviews.Content: I had a very wonderful pleasure to stay at the Radisson Hotel Phoenix City Center. This hotel is a very great "secret" of hotels in Phoenix. All of the staff that I encountered had the greatest customer service; the restaurant had awesome food and drink. I enjoyed the pools and the room was great. I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who travels to Phoenix. You should be proud to be a Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient downtown location with great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: lbinder06
Reviews.Content: Nice well lit rooms and grounds. Enticing pool and patio. Property looks to be newly remodeled and updated. My hotel room was exceptionally clean, with plenty of fresh towels. Quiet atmosphere makes for pleasant nights sleep. Restaurant provides varied and delicious fare. Hotel employees engaged and happy to provide great guest service.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: katkat_90713
Reviews.Content: Found this Hotel on Expedia.....it was really nice and clean hotel, the people who worked here are very friendly they would really assist you if you need anything. Had a great time with my husband staying at this hotel. We will surely stay here again next time we come back to Phoenix. Very nice......

Reviews.Title: “Being pissed off starts at check in...”
Reviews.Author: Grizzly78
Reviews.Content: ... When, at 3.30pm, they tell me I can't actually get into my room because it's being cleaned. So they make me sit in reception like a lemon for thirty minutes. Way to start a business trip, guys! That pretty much sums this place up: grotty, sloppy service, unenjoyable to visit. Oh, and despite it's name it's actually about two miles from downtown. rooms were pretty basic, too. So basically don't bother

Reviews.Title: “So - So”
Reviews.Author: JTColorado
Reviews.Content: Good: grounds/landscape are beautiful, nice pool area, easy/efficient check-in process, close to light rail, a few restaurants within walking distance, decent price Bad: smaller rooms, had significant problems with AC unit, no hot tub, no complimentary breakfast Not a bad place but better can probably be found.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Surprise”
Reviews.Author: bonesmommy
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled for the first time to Phoenix for spring training. I got this hotel through expedia. I know Radissons usually are nice hotels so I chose this location. I was pleasently suprised by the condition of the hotel and pool. The hotel looked like it recently had been remodled. The room was very clean and also had new sleep number beds. The pool looked like it was straight out of hotels Ive stayed in in cancun with Tall rock waterfalls. I noticed that all children were kept in a certain area in the hotel which actually made me more comfortable traveling with a toddler. The food also was exceptional. We had room service a couple nights and the food was up in less than 20 minutes. Location of the hotel is great if you have a rental car. We were 5-7 minutes from downtown where the suns play. I really never write reviews but the Radisson really made my trip comfortable and relaxing and I just wanted to give them a huge thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price & great location”
Reviews.Author: sunzfan58
Reviews.Content: I had read numerous negative reviews about this hotel AFTER I booked it for three days stay and I must admit, I was pretty concerned. However, the adult store they mention is not right across the street, it is on the corner across the street of the Holiday Inn! I recently stayed at this hotel for three days while on buisness and found it to be very clean, relaxing and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and nice. I requested a room close to the elevator because I was recovering from a fractured foot and the staff accomodated me. My room was right next to an elevator, but it was quiet and peaceful. I would stay again. The only concern that I had was the parking...although it is right next to the hotel, the security guards do not come on til 10 p.m., so if you check in or return to your room before 10 p.m. there is no security monitoring the parking area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: MvGel
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is centrally located with easy access to everythying. The hotel is clean and the furnishing seem reasonably new. Rooms are a bit on the small side. Radisson has the Sleep Number bed, which some people like (I don't). Breakfast is mediocre and costs $9.00. Service is friendly and parking is free, as is wired internet access. Rates were pretty reasonable when compared to other comparable hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: chicago77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my sisters wedding. the rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was great! From my initial reservation to the reception when we arrived I could not have asked for better service. There were a lot of people coming in from out of town and from what I heard they were able to accomidate everyone and we all really enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but headaches”
Reviews.Author: NASKAL18
Reviews.Content: This trip was my second time staying at this hotel. I work for the racetrack and come out every April and November from California to cover the races at PIR. We're always put up in this Radisson and I think it's high time we change. In April, I stayed 3 nights (Thurs-Sat). I didn't have much problem with the place, except for the fact it's about half an hour away from the track, but that's not the hotel's fault. When I came back in November, my colleague and I came a day early and had to stay at our own hotel, which we chose to be the Holiday Inn Express in Goodyear (right down the street from the track). We had a lovely stay, comfortable beds, linens and breakfast were all superb. We were sad to leave that hotel and move to the Radisson on Thursday night, but we had no idea how sad we were going to be. Once we left the track and got to the hotel at around 11:30pm Thursday, the front desk clerk asked for our reservation, which had been made for a double room. Of course, there was a problem in the system and it was reserved as a single king room, not exactly the proper sleeping arrangement for coworkers! We told them they made a mistake and needed to get us a double, to which the woman replied they were COMPLETELY booked up, even tho there were only about 20 cars in the parking structure, and they had no rooms open. She said she could leave a note to make sure that tomorrow night we got a double room, but that's the best she could do. I asked if there was a cot or anything I could sleep on, and she suggested I sleep on the ARMCHAIR in the room! After 15 minutes of arguing, she finally magically found a single queen up in the "cabana" area that I could have. We took the rooms under the assurance that both were covered by the track and that we would have doubles the next evening, even if we came in at midnight again. My poor colleagues room, the one we were supposed to share, was right behind the elevators and she didn't get a wink of sleep thanks to the sound of them going up and down all night. My room was outside on a patio with a drained pool (all equipment left out by it, very unsightly) and was a handicap accessible room. Not a huge deal, but there was no counter to put anything on in the restroom, just a sink. When I flopped down on the bed, I was exhausted and not happy to hit a concrete slab of a mattress and itchy linens. I got up to take a shower and found the TINY towels to be itchy and rough, leaving a rash as I tried to dry off! The next morning as I was getting dressed my phone rang and it was the same lady from the lobby the night before accusing me of having come down and eaten breakfast without paying! Turns out she called my colleague and accused her too! Neither of us had left our rooms, and for them to call us at 7:30 AM seems a bit early. Yes we were up, but what if we hadn't been? I don't think it's good customer service to call and accuse your guests of something at early morning hours. The next night we came to the lobby and found that SURPRISE, there was no note left, no double rooms available and we had to stay with the current rooms. We decided to just leave well enough alone and be happy to have a bed to sleep in and stopped asking after that night if they had a room open for us. On Saturday night there was a wedding reception being held in the restaurant and the extremely drunken guests were smoking pot in the hallways and rooms and propositioning people, including myself, in the elevator! Then at about 1 AM the bride and groom came out to the rooftop patio and got into a huge argument about who was going to go down to the XXX Shop that is just across the street, then smoked some more pot outside my door. Not exactly a restful nights sleep. I sincerely hope we don't have to stay here again, there is nothing to do nearby, the area is very shady and as two young women, we didn't feel very safe. If you're in town for the races, go with the Holiday Inn Express in Goodyear! Much more to do, safer and closer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Cheap Price!!”
Reviews.Author: alisontheresealison
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely and the price was so cheap! I stayed here for two nights and had a great time. The staff was very nice and the restaurant downstairs had great food and the breakfast was cheap and nice! Best part was the pool outside. My friend and I had it to ourselves the whole day and it was nice with all the waterfalls. Got a great deal for seventy bucks a night on the internet. Will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: teach2nd
Reviews.Content: My daughter, friend and I stayed here in October and would stay there again. Great staff, great room, sleep number bed (which was fun), and nice property. We also loved the staff. Yes the area may be a little run down, but we found it safe and central to everywhere we went. The light rail is up the road, food is around, and a store close by. Oh, the hotel food was great too, which was a pleasant surprise. Only downer was no heated pool and they needed to turn it on when their temp. dropped. The desk clerk Bizzare was the best (yes that's her name). You can't get any nicer with her.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Training in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: tafoyama
Reviews.Content: Earlier this year we went to Phoenix to see a Spring training game for the Dodgers. Had a very nice weekend and a great time at the ballgame. The baseball facility is really nice - very new and beautiful. We should have gone to more than one game while we were there but had only planned for one game. Phoenix was ok but not great. I'm sure there was more to do than we did but since the purpose of our trip was the game, we didn't seek too much out. We ate at Sylvia's La Canasta restaurant which was very overrated. It wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. We stayed at the Radisson City Center which was fine but not great, but for the price there was good value. It's an older hotel but everything was fine. We completely overpaid for a rental car - I think we got it through Avis but all were the same price....something ridiculous. It had to be because of Spring Training that the prices were so high. Not sure what we could have done about that but I should have booked it earlier for sure. All in all it was a good trip - I'd go back for more Spring training games but would plan a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable-Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: sharpnup
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night, excellent value for money. Clean comfortable rooms with nice pool and free gym onsite. Close to the Metro line for public transportation, free parking onsite. Staff were helpful with maps and suggestions on places to eat in the City. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: waitforit
Reviews.Content: *Please note, I didn't stay at the hotel but made reservations for someone else* I initially called the Radisson by the Airport on University Drive to reserve a room for some relatives passing through PHX. They had a great rate of $66/night but refused to guarantee smoking preference or bed size. I then called the Radisson Hotel Phoenix City Center and spoke to Matt. He gave me a rate of $62.40, a king bed, and could guarantee the entire hotel was non-smoking! Thanks Matt!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice for a meeting venue in Phoenix. A little tough to find.”
Reviews.Author: stubbs1970
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five nights, and we had a series of business meetings using the hotel facilities. It was a very good, and very convenient, choice. Rooms were quiet and comfortable. Our attendees got a very good deal. Service from everyone - banquet staff, front desk, maintenance, and housekeeping - was excellent. Some of the facilities were a little difficult - for example, no indoor restrooms near the meeting rooms and a very small and not terribly convenient restaurant. Food service for the meetings was good, but the variety was a little limited. Regarding the restaurant, it has limited hours, with no lunch hour. Excellent service, very good food, but very limited variety and selection. There are a number of local options for restaurants, though, particularly if you have a car. This location is very convenient. Even in rush hour, it was a short and quick ride to the airport. The location is close to downtown Phoenix, and the commuter rail service is a short walk, if you are so inclined. Parking was adequate, even with a wedding in the hotel during our first night there. Fitness facility was acceptable, and the pool area with some other recreation options is very nice. About the only negative thing is that the signage for the hotel is so small that we had a number of attendees have difficulty finding it. A coworker emailed me very specific directions, so I had no trouble. But I did not see the sign until after I had already parked and walked up to the front door. We are likely to use this venue again, and I would certainly use it for leisure activities in the Phoenix area. Everything of interest is in easy driving distance, and parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, But This Hotel Needs a Facelift!”
Reviews.Author: mayos4
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Radisson for a photography convention. The standard 2 queen room was very small. It seemed a bit rundown - carpet frayed, furniture abused, and the bed skirts probably hadn't been changed or cleaned in a year. Light in the bathroom didn't work all the time. On the other hand, the staff was excellent! For the most part, very friendly and willing to help. The breakfast buffet was tasty and plentiful. The food served for our convention lunches was very good. There are also several good restaurants in the area. We were rather partial to FEZ. Not too far from the new mass transit train for a ride closer downtown and the convention center. Maybe, if the maintenance had been kept up, I would have given it a better rating. Should look better for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrincessLindz
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel from the airport after a long flight, and the man on the check in desk was friendly and extremely polite. We were checked in quickly and found our room to be spacious, comfortable and very clean. In the restaurant staff at both dinner and breakfast were friendly and helpful. Our stay was pleasant and hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix Weekend April 2008”
Reviews.Author: Mysterys_Angels
Reviews.Content: Went there for a weekend stay. The photos made the property look absolutely beautiful and the rooms very spacious. We got a Cabana Suite on the roof with a "private pool". There were no photos showing the rooms, but because it was higher priced, the assumption was that the rooms would look the same or maybe a little nicer. When we checked in, the room was very stuffy, there wasn't any kleenex in the bathroom, the room was very cramped for it accommodating 4. When the hotel was booked, I was advised that breakfast was included. Since I usually travel with the kids, I always make sure a hotel I stay at offers that. When it came to breakfast time, they told us we had to pay $8.50 per person (kids also) since we didn't purchase a separate package. Also the front desk was not very professional, seemed they were always putting the blame on the prior shift. Also when it came to booking, I reserved the room on one card, handed them another to charge. Both cards were frozen over the weekend because they charged both cards full amount (almost $900). I have stayed at beautiful hotels for the same price or even less...the Radisson in San Diego was a lot cleaner, a lot more professional, and a lot more pleasant all around. I won't be staying here again. Also, there was construction all downtown which made it difficult to get there. An adult movie store was right across the street. Try to explain that to kids!

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean, safe, newer, a bit far from anything to do”
Reviews.Author: acaciaruth
Reviews.Content: standard nicer chain hotel was was new. had a great pool area, too cold to use though. had to take a least a 15 min cab ride to get any where for stuff to do or dinner. lots of places deliver, but took over an hour and a half. the hotel car service is just alright and rather pricey. decent resturant over all

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: olddoctripod
Reviews.Content: Good location for the Heard Museum and the Phoenix Art Museum and that's it. Rooms are old, musty and grimy. We stayed for two nights and the room was dirty when we arrived and worse when we left. They remade the bed with the same sheets. Bathtub had hair in it. Room was too close to the elevator and could hear its machinery thrumming at night. On a brighter note, stayed at the Airport Hampton Inn in Tucson the next two nights and it was great. But Radisson Hotel Phoenix City Center was very disappointing. Not recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: Phoenix Place Hotel & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 3600 N. Second Ave., Phoenix, AZ 85013 (Formerly Radisson Hotel Phoenix City Center)
